Reviews Service API¶

Supports creation and moderation of room reviews, including ratings, comments, flags, and hiding/unhiding.

reviews_service.main.create_review(review_in: ~reviews_service.schemas.ReviewCreate, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), claims: ~typing.Dict = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user_claims>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Create a new review for a meeting room.

Access¶

  • Denied for roles: auditor, service_account.

  • Allowed for: regular, admin, facility_manager, moderator.

Behavior¶

  • Each user can only submit one review per room.

  • Rating and comment are validated through Pydantic.

  • The authenticated user’s ID is used as the review owner.

param review_in:

Room ID, rating, and comment.

type review_in:

ReviewCreate

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

param claims:

Decoded JWT claims containing user_id and role.

type claims:

Dict

returns:

The newly created review.

rtype:

ReviewRead

raises HTTPException:

If the role is read-only or the user already reviewed this room.

reviews_service.main.delete_review(review_id: int, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), claims: ~typing.Dict = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user_claims>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Permanently delete a review.

Access¶

  • Review owner.

  • Admin or moderator.

  • Auditor and service_account cannot delete reviews.

param review_id:

ID of the review to delete.

type review_id:

int

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

param claims:

Decoded JWT claims.

type claims:

Dict

rtype:

None

raises HTTPException:

If the review does not exist or the user is not allowed.

reviews_service.main.flag_review(review_id: int, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), claims: ~typing.Dict = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user_claims>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Flag a review as potentially inappropriate.

Access¶

  • Any authenticated user except auditor and service_account.

Behavior¶

  • Sets is_flagged = True on the review.

param review_id:

ID of the review to flag.

type review_id:

int

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

param claims:

Decoded JWT claims.

type claims:

Dict

returns:

The updated review after flagging.

rtype:

ReviewRead

raises HTTPException:

If the review does not exist or user role is read-only.

reviews_service.main.get_review_or_404(db: Session, review_id: int) → Review[source]¶

Load a review by ID or raise HTTP 404.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • review_id (int) – Identifier of the review.

Returns:

The matching review instance.

Return type:

Review

Raises:

HTTPException – If the review does not exist.

reviews_service.main.hide_review(review_id: int, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), _: ~typing.Dict = Depends(dependency=<function require_roles.<locals>.dependency>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Hide a review from public room listings.

Access¶

  • Admin or moderator.

Behavior¶

  • Sets is_hidden = True.

param review_id:

ID of the review to hide.

type review_id:

int

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

returns:

The updated review after hiding.

rtype:

ReviewRead

reviews_service.main.list_all_reviews(room_id: int | None = Query(None), user_id: int | None = Query(None), only_flagged: bool = False, include_hidden: bool = True, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), _: ~typing.Dict = Depends(dependency=<function require_roles.<locals>.dependency>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Admin/Moderator/Auditor view of all reviews with filters.

Access¶

  • Allowed roles: admin, moderator, auditor.

Optional filters¶

  • room_id : filter by room.

  • user_id : filter by review author.

  • only_flagged : if True, only return flagged reviews.

  • include_hidden : if False, exclude hidden reviews.

param room_id:

Room filter.

type room_id:

Optional[int]

param user_id:

User filter.

type user_id:

Optional[int]

param only_flagged:

Whether to restrict results to flagged reviews.

type only_flagged:

bool

param include_hidden:

Whether to include hidden reviews in the response.

type include_hidden:

bool

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

returns:

Reviews matching the specified filters.

rtype:

List[ReviewRead]

reviews_service.main.list_room_reviews(room_id: int, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Public endpoint: list visible reviews for a specific room.

Behavior¶

  • Returns only reviews where is_hidden is False.

  • Sorted by creation time in descending order.

param room_id:

Room whose reviews are requested.

type room_id:

int

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

returns:

Non-hidden reviews for the given room.

rtype:

List[ReviewRead]

Health-check endpoint for the Reviews service.

Returns:

A small JSON payload indicating that the service is running.

Return type:

dict

reviews_service.main.update_review(review_id: int, update_data: ~reviews_service.schemas.ReviewUpdate, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), claims: ~typing.Dict = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user_claims>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Update an existing review’s rating and/or comment.

Access¶

  • Review owner.

  • Admin or moderator.

  • Auditor and service_account cannot modify reviews.

Behavior¶

  • Only provided fields are updated.

  • Uses Pydantic validation for rating and comment.

param review_id:

ID of the review to update.

type review_id:

int

param update_data:

New rating and/or comment.

type update_data:

ReviewUpdate

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

param claims:

Decoded JWT claims.

type claims:

Dict

returns:

Updated review.

rtype:

ReviewRead

raises HTTPException:

If the review does not exist or the user is not allowed.

Models¶

class reviews_service.models.Review(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model representing a room review.

id¶

Primary key.

Type:

int

user_id¶

Identifier of the user who wrote the review.

Type:

int

room_id¶

Identifier of the room being reviewed.

Type:

int

rating¶

Numerical rating, constrained to the range 1–5.

Type:

int

comment¶

Free-text comment describing the user’s experience.

Type:

str

is_flagged¶

Whether the review has been flagged as potentially inappropriate.

Type:

bool

is_hidden¶

Whether the review is hidden from public room listings.

Type:

bool

created_at¶

Timestamp when the review was created.

Type:

datetime

Schemas¶

class reviews_service.schemas.ReviewBase(*, room_id: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=1)], rating: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=1), Le(le=5)], comment: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=1), MaxLen(max_length=1000)])[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Base schema for review content.

Includes the target room, rating, and comment text, along with basic validation and sanitization for the comment field.

comment: str¶
model_config: ClassVar[ConfigDict] = {}¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

rating: int¶
room_id: int¶
classmethod strip_comment(v: str) → str[source]¶

Normalize and validate the comment field.

  • Strips leading/trailing whitespace.

  • Rejects empty comments after stripping.

class reviews_service.schemas.ReviewCreate(*, room_id: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=1)], rating: Annotated[int, Ge(ge=1), Le(le=5)], comment: Annotated[str, MinLen(min_length=1), MaxLen(max_length=1000)])[source]¶

Bases: ReviewBase

Schema for creating a new review.

Reuses all fields and validation rules from ReviewBase.

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

Schema returned when reading review data.

Extends ReviewBase with identifiers and moderation flags.

class reviews_service.schemas.ReviewUpdate(*, rating: Annotated[int | None, Ge(ge=1), Le(le=5)] = None, comment: Annotated[str | None, MinLen(min_length=1), MaxLen(max_length=1000)] = None)[source]¶

Bases: BaseModel

Schema for partially updating an existing review.

All fields are optional; when present they are validated in the same way as on creation.

comment: str | None¶

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

rating: int | None¶
classmethod strip_comment(v: str) → str[source]¶

Normalize and validate the updated comment text.

  • Strips leading/trailing whitespace.

  • Rejects empty comments after stripping.

Database¶

reviews_service.database.get_db()[source]¶

Yield a SQLAlchemy database session for the Reviews service.

This function is intended for use as a FastAPI dependency, providing a scoped session per request and ensuring that the session is closed once the request is finished.

Yields:

Session – Active SQLAlchemy session bound to the reviews database engine.

Authentication & RBAC¶

async reviews_service.auth.get_current_user_claims(credentials: ~fastapi.security.http.HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(dependency=<fastapi.security.http.HTTPBearer object>, use_cache=True, scope=None)) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Decode a JWT bearer token and extract user claims for reviews.

The token is expected in the Authorization header as a Bearer token.

Parameters:

credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – Parsed Authorization header.

Returns:

Dictionary containing: - ‘user_id’ : int - ‘username’ : str - ‘role’ : str

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

Raises:

HTTPException – If the token is missing, invalid, or cannot be decoded.

reviews_service.auth.require_roles(*allowed_roles: str) → Callable[source]¶

Build a dependency that enforces allowed roles on review endpoints.

Parameters:

allowed_roles (str) – One or more role names that are permitted to access the route.

Returns:

A FastAPI dependency that checks the caller’s role from JWT claims and raises HTTP 403 if access is not allowed.

Return type:

Callable
